p: In the FTIR spectrum of KH550 ( Figure 2b), the characteristic peaks at 1380 cm −1, 1460 cm −1 and 1600 cm −1 were attributed to the stretching or bending vibration of C–N, C–H, and N–H, respectively [ 32]. In the FTIR spectrum of HTPMS, the peaks at 802 cm −1, 1060 cm −1, 1260 cm −1, and 3340 cm −1 were assigned to the Si–CH 3 rocking vibration, Si–O–Si and Si–CH 3 symmetry bending, and –OH stretching vibration [ 31]. In the FTIR spectrum of MDI-50, the peaks at 2280 cm −1 and 1600 cm −1 indicate the –NCO and benzene ring skeleton. In the FTIR spectrum of K-H-PUs, the peak at 2280 cm −1 assigned for the –NCO group on MDI-50 was greatly weakened, and a new peak at the 3360 cm −1 assigned for the –NH group appeared, which means the formation of PUs. Furthermore, the characteristic peaks at 802 cm −1, 1060 cm −1, and 1260 cm −1 mean that the organic silicone was successfully modified on PUs.
